question: How much experience do you have with React?
options: No experience, I’m a beginner
Basic level, I have built simple components
Intermediate, I have built small projects
Advanced, I have built production-level applications

question: Have you ever worked in a team that used React?
options: No, I only worked on personal projects
I have participated in small team projects
I have worked in startups
I have worked in large-scale professional teams

question: Which of the following React areas have you learned so far?
options: None
JSX, Props & State
Functional Components & Hooks
Class Components and Lifecycle Methods

options: No, I haven’t built any projects yet
I have built a few simple projects
I have built several projects in a team setting

options: Not at all familiar
Somewhat familiar
Comfortable with basic JSX
Fully proficient with complex JSX structures

options: I’m not familiar with Hooks
I understand basic hooks like useState and useEffect
I regularly use hooks, including custom hooks

I use the useEffect hook for basic side effects
I sometimes use external libraries for advanced side effects
I am fully proficient in managing side effects with custom hooks and advanced techniques

options: I have never used a routing library
I have basic experience with React Router
I have used both React Router and Reach Router
I have advanced experience with complex routing techniques

question: How do you manage state in your React applications?

I use Context API for simple state management

I combine multiple approaches (local state, Context, Redux, etc.) effectively

options: I only use plain CSS
I use CSS frameworks like Bootstrap
I use CSS-in-JS libraries such as Styled Components or Emotion
I use a combination of approaches tailored to project needs

I use Axios for API calls
I use advanced libraries like react-query or SWR for efficient data fetching

I have advanced experience with Suspense in concurrent mode
